document.title: Georgia Standards of Excellence CTEA Hospitality and Tourism

9FDDA5620F4C476A870A43A2867CCFE5.description: Research and explain the effect seasonality of fresh fruit and vegetables has on availability and pricing and the impact on menu planning and purchasing decisions. Including the pros and cons related to product sustainability, food miles, and "carbon footprints."

DD8F18D13D264E7E98F6E3BFAD5FAD97.description: Using a wholesale price list determine the recipe cost per serving for various recipes used in your kitchen labs.

7A37324EBB1B477EB38BDDE691BA65EC.description: Research methods for determining price comparisons on specified products based on wholesale purveyor price lists.

BB6A62D219B543FF84B1015109721028.description: Identify terminology used to classify sizes, types and quantities of meats, poultry, seafood, dairy products, fresh fruits and vegetables, canned food products, including definitions such as can sizes and bushel and peck measurements.

3B24F88D913547DFBF1DF6EDB5A9D059.description: Research the concept of product purchasing specifications and their importance in purchasing decisions and identify product specifications for purchasing meat, poultry, seafood, dairy and staple food items.

C1C7EE70A6CC49C8B2A750049898CDDF.description: Analyze the requirements for selecting food, chemical, and disposable product purveyors.

BCB6E7C5B56441F79AAAB04A5E13C0B3.description: Identify various foods used in a commercial kitchen and bake shop and analyze the purchasing procedures for each.

821851D19E8F44348D8DDC5EF40B9F9A.description: Write a catering menu for a fictitious catering business using descriptive selling terminology to include entrees, salads, appetizers, beverages and desserts.

011E1CCEA3EA410EAAA7CA80735607D9.description: Create and design a menu layout for a fictitious restaurant with menu item descriptions that follow established truth-in-menu guidelines. Define terminology for classical French garnishes for hot foods and incorporate in menu descriptions.

EBA68BDD0F7345AFB097447D6948DB92.description: Analyze various restaurant menus and identify standard menu layout and design concept.

0B3323C770C2433BA415A0931A533E16.description: Identify menu requirements for various diets such as food allergies, vegetarian, reduced sodium, and/or low calorie.

DFCE5839703243E38676F6F59FBA1013.description: Identify and describe various foodservice restaurant styles such as quick service, casual, family dining, institutional (contract food services), and fine dining.

51EB75D6B0DD491396227A12E220BD89.description: Identify and research basic written menu planning principles discussing the various types of restaurant menus: a la carte, table d'hote, California, du jour, and cycle and their importance to the overall operation of the facility.

69DFF8EBDBF042A5A8715C49CA223B81.description: Identify and apply menu planning fundamentals for various food-service types and for various diets and allergies.

3416F444168B488082DC1C3E45A1EB3A.description: Analyze stress and conflict resolution in the workplace.

251EEAA452FE4956BCC67182EC53D18F.description: Identify and research legal issues of employment to include sexual harassment, discriminations, American Disabilities Act, work hour issues, overtime pay, progress discipline, terminations; Georgia "Right to Work" status, I-9 forms, and E-Verify program.

2D5FBA5B53C64EF6A6C314545899A561.description: Maintain a personal portfolio to include documents supporting skills and creative talents, awards, assessments, etc.

2DBB9E09C8D14E11B3912CB525804A2A.description: Prepare or update personal resume; prepare job applications, letters of recommendations and thank you notes.

005156ACB2C641B4A84E74E6E514DAA9.description: Research the various "do's and don'ts" of the behaviors involved in being employed.

B6DDCC69D50040DDA3B7D086EA613263.description: Research proper dress, dining etiquette, verbal communication skills and appropriate behaviors during a job interview and perform a mock job interview with student demonstrating proper dress, behavior and communication skills.

99816444E1084420838DB1558865F235.description: Select a management crisis situation and role play the scenario and solutions to managing the situation.

C6692ED780E2494D910031127A88E6D4.description: Identify and research management leadership and describe leadership qualities such as honesty and integrity, fairness, responsible behavior, ethical work habits, passion for goals, positive attitude, initiative, enthusiasm and empathy.

5C43C3C324374724978571326E350B65.description: Identify and exhibit appropriate oral and written communications on a personal and professional level.

8D7771BA537947A5A38CDF6CD7B5A1A1.description: Apply fundamentals of human relations and management skills in both personal and professional aspects and levels.

703D3E39CADC47F0BCB6A400FF5F7B03.description: Examine current trends and issues in food and nutrition, fad diets and proper weight loss techniques and discuss how they fit in healthy menu options.

B790B723FC704F2A9E617F2A5D422E89.description: Identify and demonstrate appropriate serving sizes and portion control as related to dietary needs as compared to current industry trends with specific emphasis on obesity.

F7DB3775C4894A1D8060DEC83A17483C.description: Analyze and develop a daily and week personal menu that reflects the RDI values including the six major nutrients and caloric daily intakes.

DE547ADEF43F4F5FB9262A847FDA0C76.description: Examine the nutritional concepts that affect the food service industry today with emphasis on a healthy diets, allergies, and obesity issues.

FA3AC8983F0A4F56AEE4AD28581B32EA.description: Prepare non yeast baked goods to include biscuits, quick breads, muffins, basic pie dough, fruit pies, and cookie varieties using recipes converted to metric measurements.

1BBA6E815A244B89B23AC606907C7362.description: Define baker's formula for use in recipes development and demonstrate the use of a baker's scale.

0968D8CD49124D50A1C743EA30D710CA.description: Convert baking recipes to metric measurements.

0FDDB8CE037B4110AD69579C4DE131D3.description: Identify ingredients used in baking, describing their properties, and listing their functions and uses in recipes.

82F6ED2097504841962F4BD5EE4FAAB1.description: Define basic baking terms; identify fixed equipment, small wares and utensils used in baking and describe their proper use and care.

6F1D86C4942E4C7CA763D46BE8077E0C.description: Identify and apply fundamentals of baking in the preparation and production of baked food products and will identify and use equipment normally found in the bakeshop.

383975D07FD345DA91A77BD09F3A4D51.description: Roast whole garlic and utilize in a recipe.

0140491BC982464EBDE4E33173A040A9.description: Identify and prepare various breakfast foods to include breakfast meats, eggs, cereals, and batter products.

8D8FE61190024BFB9FD8CE4134BF762E.description: Define and prepare soup types including consommé, clear and cream soups, regional and international soups.

AAAE65C1EF714BB3937976FABEE0713C.description: Define and prepare sauces including the five mother sauces and their common derivatives

7ABE3C968B1147B2B2A26E4AEAE967CC.description: Define and prepare basic chicken, vegetable and meat stocks.

9B4B473A80104DFA8329294A536770E3.description: Prepare a variety of ingredients and recipes using combination-cooking methods including braising and stewing.

72D4C8CF3A0B4A9986199CEB025BD107.description: Prepare a variety of food ingredients and recipes using dry cooking methods, including sauté, pan frying, deep-frying, baking, roasting, grilling, and broiling.

24168F6B00B44FC5B756467E12F49BBF.description: Prepare a variety of food ingredients and recipes using moist heat cooking method including blanching, boiling, steaming, and poaching.

68928C9FB4424FDEA1B5F40855F720F6.description: Examine the various cooking methods, techniques, and preparations such as dry heat, combination and moist heat methods. Perform basic food preparations of poultry, meat, dairy, fruits, and vegetables using proper commercial kitchen equipment and techniques to examine these fundamental methods, as applied in a commercial kitchen.

7182346DB49342F3818A5499761E6E17.description: Fabricate a whole chicken and explain the concept of cost and wholesale/retail pricing on whole versus parts.

37571F217BFD47DAA5FF4EEABD56D7CE.description: Discuss applicability to a food-service operation of convenience, value-added, further processed, or par-cooked food items.

8524C7860C3649369EE207A7EF07E183.description: Demonstrate cooking techniques such as blanching and sweating.

9C24BDD5BAD8454E9F6EA8D98898490C.description: Demonstrate competency skills for the proper knife cuts such as julienne, battonet, brunoise, paysanne, small, medium, and large dice, rondele, concasse and oblique.

4A7D67428CE5419194000FBB9CE3CB9C.description: Apply effective "mise en place" through lab practice.

9D536C7E8071495D8A2D853712DB5EE7.description: Identify and demonstrate the use of fresh and dried herbs and spices, spice blends, oils, vinegars, marinades, and dry rubs.

C39106CC48F34040A7149BAA12B703A3.description: Identify and demonstrate the principles and processes of cooking in a professional kitchen.

771ECF089F1F482498CEF9708331A1A2.description: Calculate "as purchased" and "edible portions" yields for various food items including vegetables, meats, poultry and seafood

F2D02B44287C4148898710D3035BC2EE.description: Develop and use a list of equivalent measurements of various ingredients

45A25755C23A4276A461A88AB95F7E0E.description: Convert standardized recipes to metric measurements.

966C52AD934D4EE48A2DDB7592C95359.description: Demonstrate, solve, and apply standard recipe conversions.

616455FEA10A4F58952DE3F87F76C185.description: Identify and use weights and measures to demonstrate proper scaling and measurement techniques including both U.S. measurements and metric measurements.

60402D712E2E478BB4A2EB64BACB014A.description: Demonstrate basic knowledge in business and culinary math skills.

742C1B45EDD1450394165AC9E52F9C12.description: Distinguish between the various metals and the properties used for small wares, pots and pans, and fixed equipment.

7190DAB8823A4D37BB059DE5C7E5A225.description: Demonstrate, with instructor supervision, the various uses of a mandoline.

573C7BE55475476F9B04B2157489B73B.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the rules, legal and safety issues regarding the use of a meat slicer and where applicable the operation of a meat slicer.

D0051A4083584D4794D816C251C91AB7.description: Demonstrate the proper use of chemicals used in the kitchen, including detergents, degreasers, oven cleaners and sanitizers.

9DB93B5E517D49088A4D4D4B09E8CFA3.description: Explain the function and use of hot and cold holding and serving equipment.

F04A88E3F7F5435FA30848C726A0F70D.description: Demonstrate proper use of food processors, table top mixers, blenders, brewing equipment for coffee and tea, ice cream freezers, portable induction ranges, portable butane burners.

2F99959CB03F4ED1A1E8B649F9183E85.description: Demonstrate the proper use of the various measuring tools such as ladles, scales, scoops, and measuring cups and spoons to weigh, measure, and portion.

7783688A8A1440D09F5F410B11E768EA.description: Show how to properly store food supplies in reach-in and walk-in refrigerators, and walk-in freezers.

5BB7D802B2A34550AB6C0B13E3932743.description: Demonstrate the proper dish machine cleaning procedures for dishes, glassware, flatware etc. (if applicable).

23CF08D1BE70404D9BE7C214F98175DA.description: Demonstrate the proper manual cleaning for dishes, glassware, flatware, pots and pans, etc.

0CCB609C7F9748F5B6CB515D5DD7087C.description: Demonstrate operation of professional kitchen equipment to include but not limited to ranges, mixers, microwave ovens, steam cabinets, deep fat fryers, steam tables, ranges, broilers, and reach-in refrigerators and freezers, etc.

93CB3C4795AA448483AF1BAEC8924CAD.description: Demonstrate proper procedures for cleaning and maintaining professional kitchen equipment including ranges, convection ovens, deep fat fryers, steam cabinets, floor mixers, steam jacket kettles, tilt skillets, grills, griddles, microwave ovens, refrigerators and freezers, etc.

B4AA20C768594E9393BE89E92A4C5F32.description: Acquire and apply basic knowledge of using and maintaining professional kitchen equipment.

F9692AE48D6D4BA99AC78DD435AF9927.description: Validate student's knowledge and understanding of the food safety and sanitation principles by administering to the student a nationally recognized food safety certification assessment such as SERVSAFE's Food Protection Manager Certification. (Students who do not successfully pass the SERVSAFE or equivalent national exam must pass an academically challenging and rigorous "in-house" exam similar to the national assessments).

C25F86930E264C82BB149C5AF8667778.description: Demonstrate the proper use, care, and cleaning of commercial food-service equipment and facilities.

7BA49517403F4667A136791586D7A762.description: Follow state and local sanitation and safety codes.

97347E046DA940899165D0E77424D293.description: Identify the history, purpose and requirements of Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) relating to food-service operations and emphasize the use of equipment, such as meat slicers and mandolines and age restrictions of employees.

470964AFE7354EA99B72CBC925FF83E1.description: Identify the principles of Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Points (HACCP), relating to the flow of food through the foodservice operation.

E3BB470324EC4F96A2A1F4175E0BDE10.description: Identify and re-examine basic safety practices such as lifting and carrying, including basic first aid.

781E5F090B9E4824A276A6E47CE88797.description: Describe food security and identify differences between food safety and food security.

6A3AF61D66C246C2BB070F97A358F3C1.description: Demonstrate maintenance of necessary records to document time and temperature control, employee health, equipment maintenance, and other food preparation and storage.

2EC942C671E54C18868243F1D59567F4.description: Demonstrate waste disposal and recycling methods and describe appropriate measures for insect, rodent, and pest control.

C969399A86704348B4DF27F843696208.description: Examine current types and proper uses of cleaning materials and sanitizers and demonstrate procedures for cleaning and sanitizing utensils, equipment, and facilities.

959F7B67456D4E4CA603F24123EA39ED.description: Identify the factors that affect the growth of food-borne pathogens, FAT TOM, and explain how time and temperature guidelines can reduce growth of microorganisms.

BE75B216D8D8420A8FD34A617AC65724.description: List and demonstrate food handling, preparation and storage techniques that prevent cross contamination between raw and ready-to-eat foods and between animal or fish, including sources of other potentially hazardous food products.

0C39077CB4DE4C889A586942E1D4D39A.description: Demonstrate proper receiving and storage of both raw and prepared foods, including identification of appropriate storage temperatures for perishable and semi-perishable foods.

63AF94D348A14E2CBE95A6EEA66D730D.description: Identify common allergens and major food-borne illnesses, including associated symptoms, and methods of prevention.

D29292E3C12C4C99A828934D83A956F7.description: Identify and describe methods to prevent biological, chemical and physical contaminants and methods to prevent contamination of food and differentiate between food-borne intoxication, infections and toxin-mediated infections.

799CE219F7F04D2E8F005C4EB5F66378.description: List and identify the major reasons for and recognize signs of food spoilage and contamination.

703299C69CCB4D6A9E91D5C6C7BF47D1.description: Identify and categorize microorganisms related to food spoilage and food-borne illnesses; describe their requirements and methods for growth.

8F8B1C0A54714A7984AC8C96852B735C.description: Identify personal behaviors that can contaminate food and demonstrate good personal hygiene and health habits, including proper hand washing.

566545632A4147749B8F254323540595.description: Identify the characteristics of potentially hazardous foods, recognize risks associated with high risk populations, and list the reasons of keeping food safe through SERVSAFE applications.

75EAF708A1384B569CDD232B9B91E9B8.description: Examine and apply the principles of food sanitation and safety in foodservice operations and kitchen environments to achieve a nationally recognized food safety certificate.

B27283A30DCB4BEF905A8242CD28A8E4.description: Present a professional image through appearance, behavior and language.

A3CD5998E28149FF975EA93D05CBD501.description: Apply the appropriate skill sets to be productive in a changing, technological, diverse workplace to be able to work independently and apply teamwork skills.

0090A4C52B79414A81107DA424942848.description: Model work readiness traits required for success in the workplace including integrity, honesty, accountability, punctuality, time management, and respect for diversity.

4DAE28BA7E0B49768D68A300CE4409D1.description: Exhibit critical thinking and problem solving skills to locate, analyze and apply information in career planning and employment situations.

662C0464BF7F4DBFB1EE358EC79DB44E.description: Demonstrate creativity by asking challenging questions and applying innovative procedures and methods.

0D6C71B9396B4B52AA5D6A1356AB4F15.description: Communicate effectively through writing, speaking, listening, reading, and interpersonal abilities.

4878027B1DC44AE48101A12453A17397.description: Demonstrate employability skills required by business and industry.
